name: Lime and Miso-Glazed Salmon
author: Ethan Block
summary: Not only is this recipe simple and fast to make, but it's so full of flavor that it will taste like you spent hours on it! Serve the miso-glazed salmon over Sichuan-style French beans and rice.
directions: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C)
Whisk mirin, miso, soy sauce, brown sugar, and lime juice together in a bowl or high-rimmed tray
Immerse salmon fillets in the marinade
Heat a well oiled grill pan over medium heat
Add the salmon fillets, reserving marinade in the bowl
Cook, flipping as needed, until grill marks form, 2 to 3 minutes per side
Place salmon fillets onto a baking sheet and spoon reserved marinade over each fillet
Bake in the preheated oven until fish flakes easily with a fork, about 6 minutes
